justification: The article states that “risk taking as measured by the widely used Balloon Analogue Risk Task (BART) is predictive of smoking,” indicating BART is used to operationalize the construct of risk taking.
It is mentioned that “risk seeking in the Iowa Gambling Task is predictive of substance abuse,” showing that the Iowa Gambling Task serves as a measure of the construct risk seeking.

The text notes “risk-taking propensity as captured by the ethical domain of the Domain-specific Risk-attitude Scale is predictive of buying illegal drugs,” linking the DOSPERT ethical subscale to measuring risk-taking propensity.
The article lists the “Drug Abuse Screening Test … commonly used as frequency measures of people's real-life choice behavior,” showing it operationalizes the construct of drug abuse severity.
It references “the South Oaks Gambling Screen … commonly used as frequency measures of people's real-life choice behavior,” indicating SOGS measures pathological gambling tendencies.

The text cites “the Fagerström Test for Nicotine Dependence … commonly used as frequency measures of people's real-life choice behavior,” showing this test measures the construct of nicotine dependence.
